question: 騎手
sourceMnemonic:
<ja>手</ja> takes its alternative meaning "doer" here, so that gives us <kanji>horse riding</kanji> <kanji>doer</kanji>. Who does horse riding? It’s a <vocabulary>jockey</vocabulary>.

This word usually refers to a professional or skilled rider in horse racing or equestrian sports.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
